com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.display

Class ColorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.display.ColorManager

  • public class ColorManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides APIs for changing the device display. The color manager will maintain separate instances for each display type. A static method, getInstance is provided for requesting an instance of the class for each display type.
    The sequence of APIs calls are as follows:
    1) connect(), then wait for the callback to be received. Not required if this is already called once, but a call is recommended.
    2) once callback is received, then getInstance()
    3) isFeatureSupported()
    4) setColorBalance()
    5) When everything is done, call release(). This is optional.
    If an instance is already in use, a getInstance() call will return a handle to the same instance.
    Because these APIs effect the display, the application will need to restore the display to the settings before any changes were made when the application leaves the foreground. Failure to do so will cause the device display to be persisting with the previous app's display settings.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ColorManager.ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT_QUALITY_LEVEL
      This enumeration provides a list of backlight quality levels
      static interface  ColorManager.ColorManagerListener
      This listener will inform the calling app when the connection is made to the display service.
      static class  ColorManager.DCM_DISPLAY_TYPE
      This enumeration provides a list of display types that are supported by these APIs
      static class  ColorManager.DCM_FEATURE
      This enumeration provides a list of features exposed by the ColorManager class.
      static class  ColorManager.MODE_TYPE
      This enum provides a list of Mode types.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static int connect(Context context,
          ColorManager.ColorManagerListener colorListener)
        This method will start the service required for the Display SDK. This method should be called atleast once before using any other API. A callback is received once the service is connected. It is recommended to first make a call to connect() and then other API calls only after the callback is received.
        Parameters:
        context -
        colorListener - the listener to get the callback once the connection is successful
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if the request to connect succeeds and then wait for the callback.
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if any of the argument is passed null
        RET_FAILURE if the connection request fails

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        This method will avoid cloning and throw CloneNotSupportedException
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException

      • getInstance

        public static ColorManager getInstance(Application application,
                       Context context,
                       ColorManager.DCM_DISPLAY_TYPE displayId)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will return an instance of the ColorManager class for the input display id. The app will need to have the permission com.qti.snapdragon.sdk.permission.DISPLAY_SETTINGS in order to use this feature.
        Parameters:
        application -
        context - calling activity context
        displayId - id of the display for which this feature is to be used
        Returns:
        ColorManager instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is passed null or the context passed is not an activity context

      • isFeatureSupported

        public boolean isFeatureSupported(ColorManager.DCM_FEATURE feature)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method returns TRUE if the input feature is supported, FALSE otherwise.
        Parameters:
        feature - should be a value from the enum DCM_FEATURE
        Returns:
        true if the given feature is supported, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if feature id is passed null

      • setColorBalance

        public int setColorBalance(int warmth)
        This method will change the color balance warmth to the input value.
        Parameters:
        warmth - within the range (-100,100)
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if provided value is outside the range of (-100,100),
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_BALANCE is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getColorBalance

        public int getColorBalance()
        This method returns the current color balance warmth value
        Returns:
        The color balance value between (-100, 100)
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_BALANCE is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getNumOfModes

        public int getNumOfModes(ColorManager.MODE_TYPE type)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method returns the number of display modes available on device.
        Parameters:
        type - type of modes for which count is required
        Returns:
        number of modes if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is passed null

      • getActiveMode

        public int[] getActiveMode()
        This method returns an array which includes the id of the currently active display mode and a bitmask indicating there are active customizations on top of the settings encapsulated by the display mode. Refer to the field summary for bitmask values (BITFLAG_*) indicating bitmask for color balance, picture adjustment, and memory color (skin, sky, foliage).
        Returns:
        integer array if api succeeds with mode-id as parameter 0 and flag as parameter 1,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED as parameter 0 if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE as parameter 0 for all other failures

      • setActiveMode

        public int setActiveMode(int modeId)
        This method will activate a display mode, causing the device display to change accordingly. This will override the default mode if different until the device is rebooted or the default mode is set to active again.
        Parameters:
        modeId - the id of the mode which needs to be set
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if the API succeeds
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if mode id provided is negative
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getModes

        public ModeInfo[] getModes(ColorManager.MODE_TYPE type)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method returns an array of ModeInfo objects
        Parameters:
        type - type of modes for which the list is required
        Returns:
        Mode[] containing mode info.
        null if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION is not supported, if mode count is 0 and for all other reasons
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is passed null

      • deleteMode

        public int deleteMode(int modeId)
        This method will delete a USER type Mode. Note that a mode of type SYSTEM cannot be deleted. Also note that a non-system app cannot use this method. A mode that is active or default cannot be deleted.
        Parameters:
        modeId - id of the mode to be deleted.
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if the API succeeds
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_MANAGEMENT is not supported,
        RET_PERMISSION_DENIED if a non system app tries to use this API
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if mode id is less than 0

      • createNewMode

        public int createNewMode(java.lang.String modeName,
                java.util.EnumSet<ColorManager.DCM_FEATURE> featureList,
                int colorBalance)
        This method will create a new mode with the input mode name. The new mode will be of the type USER. The method will return the ID of the new mode if successful, or an error code if not successful. The mode name must be unique.
        Parameters:
        modeName - name for the new mode
        featureList - EnumSet of features that need to be set for the new mode, excluding FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_MANAGEMENT and FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION. These features will be ignored if passed in the enumset.
        colorBalance - Color balance value for the mode
        Returns:
        New Mode Id (positive number) if API succeeds
        RET_PERMISSION_DENIED if a non system app tries to use this API
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_MANAGEMENT or any of the features in the featurelist are not supported,
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if any of the provided values is outside the range,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • modifyMode

        public int modifyMode(int modeId,
             java.lang.String newName,
             java.util.EnumSet<ColorManager.DCM_FEATURE> featureList,
             int colorBalance)
        This method will modify the settings encapsulated by an existing USER mode, including its name. If the name needs to be unchanged, pass in the existing name as newName parameter.
        Parameters:
        modeId - id of the mode to be modified
        newName - new name for the mode. Pass same name if name need not be modified
        featureList - EnumSet of features that need to be set for the new mode, excluding FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_MANAGEMENT and FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION. These feature will be ignored if passed in the enumset.
        colorBalance - Color balance value for the mode
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if API succeeds
        RET_PERMISSION_DENIED if a non system app tries to use this API or attempts are made to modify a SYSTEM mode
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_MANAGEMENT or any of the features in the featurelist are not supported,
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if any of the provided values is outside the range,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getDefaultMode

        public int getDefaultMode()
        This method returns the id of the default display mode.
        Returns:
        id of the mode which is currently default for the display,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • setDefaultMode

        public int setDefaultMode(int modeId)
        This method will set a mode as the default display mode for the device. This requires that the application have system privileges as a default mode will persist a device reboot.
        Parameters:
        modeId - the id of the mode which needs to be set as default
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if the API succeeds
        RET_PERMISSION_DENIED if a non system app tries to use this API
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if mode id provided is negative
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_SELECTION is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • createNewMode

        public int createNewMode(java.lang.String modeName)
        This method will create a new mode with the input mode name. The new mode will be of the type USER. The method will return the ID of the new mode if successful, or an error code if not successful. The mode name must be unique. When a new mode is created, all features, except active control features like Sunlight Visibility and Adaptive Backlight parameters, are saved.
        Parameters:
        modeName - name for the new mode
        Returns:
        New Mode Id (positive number) if API succeeds
        RET_PERMISSION_DENIED if a non system app tries to use this API
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_MANAGEMENT is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • modifyMode

        public int modifyMode(int modeId,
             java.lang.String newName)
        This method will modify the settings encapsulated by an existing USER mode, including its name. If the name needs to be unchanged, pass in the existing name as newName parameter.
        Parameters:
        modeId - id of the mode to be modified
        newName - new name for the mode. Pass same name if name need not be modified
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if API succeeds
        RET_PERMISSION_DENIED if a non system app tries to use this API
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_COLOR_MODE_MANAGEMENT is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

        Returns:
        max sunlight visibility strength value
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is not supported
        RET_FEATURE_DISABLED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is disabled
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

        minimum sunlight visibility strength value
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is not supported
        RET_FEATURE_DISABLED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is disabled

      • setSunlightVisibilityStrength

        public int setSunlightVisibilityStrength(int strengthVal)
        This API sets the sunlight visibility strength. This API would fail if the sunlight visibility feature is not running.
        Parameters:
        strengthVal -
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is not supported,
        RET_FEATURE_DISABLED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is disabled
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if provided value is outside the range
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures. Make sure this feature is enabled

      • getSunlightVisibilityStrength

        public int getSunlightVisibilityStrength()
        This API gets the current value set for sunlight visibility strength. This API would fail if the sunlight visibility feature is not running.
        Returns:
        Strength value if API succeeds
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is not supported,
        RET_FEATURE_DISABLED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is disabled
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures, make sure the feature is enabled

      • getBacklightQualityLevel

        public ColorManager.ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT_QUALITY_LEVEL getBacklightQualityLevel()
        This API gets the quality level of adaptive backlight. Successful return of this function does not imply that adaptive backlight is running. This function may return the quality level with which adaptive backlight can be later started.
        Returns:
        quality level if successful which will be an enum value from ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT_QUALITY_LEVEL, null if feature is disabled and for other failures

      • setBacklightQualityLevel

        public int setBacklightQualityLevel(ColorManager.ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT_QUALITY_LEVEL level)
        This API sets the quality level of adaptive backlight. Successful return of this function does not imply that adaptive backlight is running. If adaptive backlight is not running then this quality level shall be applied when the feature has been started next
        Parameters:
        level - enum value from ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT_QUALITY_LEVEL
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT is not supported
        RET_FEATURE_DISABLED if FEATURE_ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT is disabled
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if level is null
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getAdaptiveBacklightScale

        public int getAdaptiveBacklightScale()
        This API gets the Backlight scale as percentage. This function will fail if adaptive backlight is not running.
        Returns:
        scale value as percentrage if API succeeds
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT is not supported
        RET_FEATURE_DISABLED if FEATURE_ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT is disabled
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • isSunlightVisibilityEnabled

        public boolean isSunlightVisibilityEnabled()
        This API will return true if Sunlight Visibility Improvement is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false if disabled

      • isAdaptiveBacklightEnabled

        public boolean isAdaptiveBacklightEnabled()
        This API will return true if Adaptive Backlight is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false if disabled

      • setSunlightVisibilityEnabled

        public int setSunlightVisibilityEnabled(boolean enable)
        This API will either start/stop or enable/disable sunlight visibility improvement feature.
        Parameters:
        enable - pass true if need to enable or false to disable
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_SUNLIGHT_VISIBILITY_IMPROVEMENT is not supported
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_ADAPTIVE_BACKLIGHT is not supported

      • getMaxLimitMemoryColor

        public int getMaxLimitMemoryColor(MemoryColorConfig.MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE type,
                         MemoryColorConfig.MEMORY_COLOR_PARAMS parameter)
        This API will return the maximum value allowed by the framework for the input parameter passed in the API. This API only applies to Memory Color parameters.
        Parameters:
        type - enum value of type MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE
        parameter - enum value from MEMORY_COLOR_DATA, denoting the required data
        Returns:
        the maximum value for the requested data
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_MEMORY_COLOR_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if type or parameter is null,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getMinLimitMemoryColor

        public int getMinLimitMemoryColor(MemoryColorConfig.MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE type,
                         MemoryColorConfig.MEMORY_COLOR_PARAMS parameter)
        This API will return the minimum value allowed by the framework for the input parameter passed in the API. This API only applies to Memory Color Parameters.
        Parameters:
        type - enum value of type MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE
        parameter - enum value from MEMORY_COLOR_DATA, denoting the required data
        Returns:
        the minimum value for the requested data
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_MEMORY_COLOR_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if type or parameter is null,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • setMemoryColorParams

        public int setMemoryColorParams(MemoryColorConfig memConfig)
        This method will change the memory color parameters to the input value.
        Parameters:
        memColorConfig - An instance of MemoryColorConfig, enclosing all memory color config values like hue, saturation and intensity as well as the type of mem color to be set
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_MEMORY_COLOR_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if memConfig or memory color type is null,
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if any parameter is outside the specified range,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getMemoryColorParams

        public MemoryColorConfig getMemoryColorParams(MemoryColorConfig.MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE type)
        This method returns the current Memory color value based on the type requested
        Parameters:
        type - enum value of type MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE
        Returns:
        MemColorConfig instance enclosing all the current Memory Color values for the requested type
        null for failures

      • disableMemoryColorConfig

        public int disableMemoryColorConfig(MemoryColorConfig.MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE type)
        This API will disable the memory color configuration based on the type passed. Once disabled, all memory color parameters which were set for the type will be lost. To enable the feature, call setMemoryColorParams().
        Parameters:
        type - MEMORY_COLOR_TYPE which needs to be disabled.
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_MEMORY_COLOR_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getMaxLimitPictureAdjustment

        public int getMaxLimitPictureAdjustment(PictureAdjustmentConfig.PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT_PARAMS parameter)
        This API will return the maximum value allowed by the framework for the input parameter passed in the API. This API only applies to Global Picture Adjustment.
        Parameters:
        parameter - enum value from PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT_PARAMS, denoting the required data
        Returns:
        the maximum value for the requested data
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_GLOBAL_PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if parameter is null,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getMinLimitPictureAdjustment

        public int getMinLimitPictureAdjustment(PictureAdjustmentConfig.PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT_PARAMS parameter)
        This API will return the minimum value allowed by the framework for the input parameter passed in the API. This API only applies to Global Picture Adjustment.
        Parameters:
        parameter - enum value from PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT_PARAMS, denoting the required parameter
        Returns:
        the minimum value for the requested parameter
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_GLOBAL_PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if parameter is null,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • setPictureAdjustmentParams

        public int setPictureAdjustmentParams(PictureAdjustmentConfig paConfig)
        This method will change the picture adjustment parameters to the input value.
        Parameters:
        PictureAdjustmentConfig - An instance of PictureAdjustmentConfig, enclosing all picture adjustment values like hue, saturation, intensity and contrast
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_GLOBAL_PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if paConfig is null,
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if any parameter is outside the specified range,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • setPictureAdjustmentSaturationThreshold

        public int setPictureAdjustmentSaturationThreshold(int thresholdVal)
        This API will set the global saturation threshold below which no adjustment happens.
        Parameters:
        thresholdVal -
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_GLOBAL_PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_VALUE_OUT_OF_RANGE if thresholdVal is outside the specified range,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • enablePictureAdjustmentDesaturation

        public int enablePictureAdjustmentDesaturation()
        This method will apply complete desaturation. However, any pixel with memory color adjustment would still show effect of saturation
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_GLOBAL_PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • disablePictureAdjustmentConfig

        public int disablePictureAdjustmentConfig()
        This API will disable the picture adjustment configuration. Once disabled, all picture adjustment parameters which were set will be lost. To enable the feature, call setPictureAdjustmentParams().
        Returns:
        RET_SUCCESS if api succeeds,
        RET_NOT_SUPPORTED if FEATURE_GLOBAL_PICTURE_ADJUSTMENT is not supported,
        RET_FAILURE for all other failures

      • getPictureAdjustmentParams

        public PictureAdjustmentConfig getPictureAdjustmentParams()
        This method returns the current Picture Adjustment values
        Returns:
        PAConfig instance enclosing all the current Picture Adjustment values
        null for failures

      • release

        public void release()
        This method will release the ColorManager object instance
